2.3 we gave a counting algorithm for connected undirected dynamic networks with a unique leader that stabilizes in 2n -2 steps . since the network is connected at all steps, it can be shown that only 2n levels of the history tree are required for this algorithm to eventually identify nodes with correct guesses on all branches . to confirm this estimate, it is sufficient to wait additional n ′ steps, which is the longest time it may take for at least one missing branch to appear in the view .
